The symptoms and findings suggest that the patient has cryptococcal meningitis, which is a fungal infection of the central nervous system. The next best step in therapy is to administer amphotericin B and 5-flucytosine, which are commonly used to treat cryptococcal meningitis. Fluconazole is not as effective as the combination of amphotericin B and 5-flucytosine. Acyclovir is used to treat viral infections, which is not the cause of the patient’s symptoms. Dexamethasone is a corticosteroid and can worsen fungal infections, so it is not recommended for treatment of cryptococcal meningitis.
